___skipTests.description: When true, does not generate "spec.ts" test files for the new project.

___skipGit.description: When true, does not initialize a git repository.

___linkCli.description: When true, links the CLI to the global version (internal development only).

___directory.description: The directory name to create the workspace in.

___inlineStyle.description: When true, includes styles inline in the component TS file. By default, an external styles file is created and referenced in the component TS file.

___prefix.description: The prefix to apply to generated selectors for the initial project.

___routing.x-prompt: Would you like to add Angular routing?
___routing.description: When true, generates a routing module for the initial project.

___minimal.description: When true, creates a project without any testing frameworks. (Use for learning purposes only.)

___inlineTemplate.description: When true, includes template inline in the component TS file. By default, an external template file is created and referenced in the component TS file.

___enableIvy.description: When true, creates a new app that uses the Ivy rendering engine.

___name.x-prompt: What name would you like to use for the new workspace and initial project?
___name.description: The name of the new workspace and initial project.

___version.description: The version of the Angular CLI to use.

x-prompt.message: Which stylesheet format would you like to use?

___style.description: The file extension or preprocessor to use for style files.

___newProjectRoot.description: The path where new projects will be created, relative to the new workspace root.

___skipInstall.description: When true, does not install dependency packages.

___viewEncapsulation.description: The view encapsulation strategy to use in the initial project.

___createApplication.description: When true (the default), creates a new initial app project in the src folder of the new workspace. When false, creates an empty workspace with no initial app. You can then use the generate application command so that all apps are created in the projects folder.
